VALVEのすべてはここから始まった。

FPSの元祖であり、オンラインプレイ、シングルプレイ双方に多大な影響をもたらした言わずと知れた「神げー」です。
ここではそんな「Half-life」の良かった点と、悪かった点を書きたいと思います。

良かった点
①グラフィック
20年以上前のグラフィックや音声にしてはとても素晴らしいものだったため。勿論今現在発売されているゲームと比べたら大きく劣るのは間違いありませんし、その様なゲームを中心にプレイしてきた方にとっては少々苦痛に感じるところもあるかもしれませんが、「その当時のグラフィック」として楽しむことは可能です。
②ストーリー
ある事件をきっかけに次々と各場面をクリアしていく、、そんなストーリーです。話はやや複雑ですし、マップも複雑に作られていて、頭を使い、周りを見ることでクリアしていくような感じですが、その分行けなかった所に行けた時の達成感は格別です。（少しホラー要素もあります）

悪かった点
①バグ
やはり昔のゲームなのでバグは多いです。
②日本語が無い！

Half-Life Is an excellent Sci-Fi first-person shooter. It is pretty classic, but it is the kind of game that created a genre.

It is pretty bare and sometimes also empty, and it did not age too well, but it is still interesting to play. It has some basic horror dynamic, a basic, but consistent lore and story, and a good and various level design.

It is a classic to try, but that is affected by its age. It is Mostly suggested for nostalgic gamers.

Ho giocato il titolo nel 2021 e posso dire che capisco il motivo per cui viene considerato una pietra miliare per il gaming. Il gioco è di genere fantascientifico, si ambienta in una struttura di ricerca in cui avviene un'incidente con un'esperimento (con la presenza del protagonista) che causa la creazione di portali da cui insorgono alieni pronti a insediarsi e a controllare o eliminare la specie umana. Sarà compito del dottor Freeman trovare una soluzione alla catastrofe verificata con vari plot twist nel bel mezzo della storia. Le cose accattivanti di questo gioco sono oltre alla lore , l'ambientazione come è stata immaginata , la fisica del gioco, della reazione degli oggetti/ A.I che interagiscono con altri e l'unione del platforming grazie ad un'ottimo game design e la qualità del gioco come First-person-shooter.
Ovviamente considerando che questo titolo è uscito nel 1998, la grafica la valuto per gli anni che erano e devo dire che era più che eccellente.

VOTO 9.5/10

You have to understand this first: I do not play shooters. My combat skills are laughable at best and freakishly abysmal at worst. My ability to platform correctly is not much better. 

I played this on Easy mode and, as one can expect, it was exceedingly difficult for me. But this game's ability to make me feel things is unmatched. Even with the 1998 graphics, I really felt like I was Gordan Freeman, living through the events of the game, experiencing his fear, horror, frustration, and exasperation. 

My creative writing teacher, in my freshman year of high school, had one rule (besides "shut up and do your homework") and that rule was "Show, don't tell." Unlike many other games I've played, this game excels at executing that principle. There are no minimaps or destination markers. There are no questlogs or tutorials. There is only you and Black Mesa (and any friends looking over your shoulder saying "Oh no, don't do that!") Everything you do you must figure out yourself, and I love that. It makes the game feel more real than any graphics software can.

I should have hated this game, and there were times that I did. But I've sort of fallen in love with it as well, because it can tell a story beautifully. If you haven't played it by now, I highly recommend checking out this classic PC gaming gem for yourself.
